question: Which of the following statements is false with regard to pricing?

answers.text: Customers are interested in the price of the product, not the cost to a company.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Costs do include both variable and fixed costs.

answers.text: Cost only includes the materials needed to produce a product.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Costs are an important factor in pricing decisions. If a company cannot cover costs, it will not be able to make a profit.

answers.text: If cost is not considered in pricing, the company will likely be unsuccessful.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Customers are most interested in the price they will pay, not the cost to the producer.

answers.text: Costs include both variable and fixed costs.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Cost does not only include the materials needed to produce a produce, but all other costs associated with doing business.

detailedSolution: Cost does not only include the materials needed to produce a produce, but all other costs associated with doing business.
